intro: Cousinia urumiensis, commonly known as the Urumie Desert cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Cousinia urumiensis is often found in desert and semi-desert environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
